FuncDef: The reset cpu-defend protocol-group statistics command deletes statistics about packets in protocol groups.
CLIs: reset cpu-defend protocol-group { whitelist | user-defined-flow | management | route-protocol | multicast | arp | mpls | access-user | link-layer | network-layer | all } statistics slot <slot-id> ap-id <ap-id>

reset cpu-defend protocol-group { whitelist | user-defined-flow | management | route-protocol | multicast | arp | mpls | access-user | link-layer | network-layer | all | system-message | blacklist | check-failed | fwddata-to-cp } statistics slot <slot-id>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the slot ID of a board.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Deletes statistics about packets in protocol groups on a specified AP in a port extension scenario.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1024 to 8191.

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset cpu-defend protocol-group route-protocol statistics slot 1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Before querying packet statistics during a period, run the reset cpu-defend protocol-group statistics command to delete existing statistics.
